data.question: What is the purpose of the ZU-62 material?
data.answer: The purpose of the ZU-62 material is for the simultaneous removal of trace propyne and propadiene from propylene.

data.question: What makes ZU-62 capable of simultaneous removal of propyne and propadiene?
data.answer: ZU-62's capability for simultaneous removal of propyne and propadiene is due to its asymmetric O/F node coordination and narrow distribution nanospace derived from special coordination geometry.

data.question: Is ZU-62 water stable?
What is the propadiene uptake capacity of ZU-62 under ultra-low pressure?
How does ZU-62 compare to SIFSIX-3-Ni in terms of propadiene uptake?
data.answer: ZU-62 has a higher propadiene uptake capacity compared to SIFSIX-3-Ni.

data.question: Does ZU-62 have a higher propyne uptake than propadiene uptake?
What is the role of the asymmetric anion pillar NbOF5 2@ in ZU-62?
data.answer: The asymmetric anion pillar NbOF5 2@ in ZU-62 customizes separate energy favorable binding sites/space for the propyne and propadiene molecules.

data.question: Can ZU-62 achieve high selectivity in separating propyne and propadiene from propylene?
What is the propyne uptake capacity of ZU-62 under ultra-low pressure?
How does the introduction of adsorbed molecules affect the accessible channel in ZU-62?
data.answer: The introduction of adsorbed molecules prompts the pyridines to be parallel to each other, making the accessible channel for the entry of guest molecules.

data.question: Is the propylene uptake by ZU-62 under 5000 ppm pressure negligible?
What is the selectivity of ZU-62 for propyne/propylene and propadiene/propylene mixtures?
data.answer: The selectivity of ZU-62 for propyne/propylene and propadiene/propylene mixtures is up to 48 and 34, respectively.

data.question: Does ZU-62 exhibit better performance in propadiene removal compared to SIFSIX-2-Cu-i?
What is the purity of eluted propylene through ZU-62 in the breakthrough experiments?
How does the asymmetric coordination geometry of ZU-62 contribute to its performance?
data.answer: The asymmetric coordination geometry of ZU-62 enables the construction of narrow-distributed multiple binding sites, simplifying the separation process and dealing with complex systems efficiently.

data.question: Does ZU-62 maintain its performance after five adsorptionâ€“desorption cycle experiments?
What is the role of the pillar pre-preparation method in the synthesis of ZU-62?
data.answer: The pillar pre-preparation method is adopted to introduce the NbOF5 2@ anion into the frameworks under less harsh synthetic conditions, solving the problem of limited applications due to the use of hydrofluoric acid and high temperature.

data.question: Is the adsorption behavior of propyne and propadiene on ZU-62 consistent with DFT calculated results?
What is the significance of the multisite-adsorbent ZU-62 in gas separation technologies?
data.answer: The multisite-adsorbent ZU-62 represents a significant advancement in gas separation technologies by enabling the highly efficient simultaneous removal of multi-component gas in one-step operation, simplifying the separation process, and reducing costs.

data.question: Does ZU-62 exhibit good thermal stability?
